Description: Monumental diorite scarab beetle, probably representing Khepri.
Curator's comments: PM VII, p.400 Minas-Nerpel, Der Gott Chepri (OLA 154, 2006), 358, note 994. Ward, The Sacred Beetle, London 1902, front page. Budge, A Guide to the Egyptian Collections in the British Museum, London 1909, 273. Hall, Scarabs, London 1929, pl. 4. De Meulener, Scarabaeus sacer, Bruxelles 1972, 4.
Associated places: Associated with: Matariya, Temple of Ra (probably from)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Thomas Bruce, 7th Earl of Elgin
